sense.name: assist someone, improve a condition, or contribute to a goal
sense.examples: Please help me carry the groceries in. The children helped around the house. The police are helping to locate the bodies. More lighting would help people see the steps. Those pills haven't helped John get well. This money is to help orphans get an education. Repainting the room white helped it to look bigger. This will help to prevent accidents. The protests actually helped increase sales. Using the learning objectives helped clarify the goals of the task.

sense.name: avail of, supply
sense.commentary: Note: usually with reflexive Includes: HELP ONESELF
sense.examples: She is helping herself to more potatoes. The waiter offered to help him to another slice of pie. He told me to help myself to the office supplies.

sense.name: refrain from doing
sense.commentary: Includes: HELP ONESELF Note: almost always used in the negative
sense.examples: They could not help watching the burning building. I couldn't help myself from eating another chocolate. Do you think she could help being a brat if she tried?
